name: ariel
text: hahaha, no, he is the bass player

name: ariel
text: he is cute too though but married

name: ariel
text: the other one with glasses

name: vincent
text: ouch.

name: ariel
text: what ouch?

name: ariel
text: that he is married

name: vincent
text: married.

name: vincent
text: do you think you have a shot at the guitar guy?

name: ariel
text: oh man i wish

name: ariel
text: but no

name: vincent
text: go for it!

name: ariel
text: well it is hard because they travel so much and i think he has a girlfriend

name: shelly
text: Not a love-em and leave-em guy?

name: ariel
text: and well you know they are from Toronto

name: ariel
text: no i don't think so

name: ariel
text: very sweet actually

name: shelly
text: I did not know that.

name: vincent
text: ha.

name: shelly
text: So how do you get the email lists? They send them to you or just give them to you when they get home?

name: ariel
text: yeah, they're Canadian eh

name: vincent
text: ha

name: ariel
text: when i see them at shows, i pick up what they have

name: ariel
text: i go see them a ton

name: vincent
text: so they come around albany a lot?

name: ariel
text: well they play the Northeast a lot

name: shelly
text: Sounds like my wife and They Might Be Giants. She loves them and sees them whenever they are in the area, or even close to the area. She's a fanatic.

name: ariel
text: and i do travel a bit to see them

name: ariel
text: yes shelly you could definitely call me a fanatic

name: vincent
text: they might be giants are super fun to see.

name: ariel
text: i have always wanted to see the

name: ariel
text: them

name: shelly
text: And TMBG have been at since the 80s. Yikes!

name: ariel
text: hahahahaha, yeah i am wondering how long i will continue to go see these guys

name: ariel
text: i think as long as they stay together

name: ariel
text: i hope they are in it for the long hall

name: vincent
text: for me TMBG were totally amazing the first time, then it gets a little less exciting as you get used to their "thing"

name: ariel
text: i just became a fan back in 2006

name: shelly
text: Have you noticed a change in their music at all in the time you've been following them?

name: shelly
text: Have they evolved or changed?

name: shelly
text: That's always interesting to me. Has that happened to your band vincent?

name: ariel
text: yeah, they are a little bit less traditional, which is ok, but i tend to like the traditional tunes they do best

name: vincent
text: yeah, we've changed a lot from recording to recording.  and we're all secretly jazz-playing guys, so the songs always sort of change in the details, like subtle improvisations and stuff

name: shelly
text: Just remembered: Great Big Sea is a great, great, celtic-oriented Canadian band. They have a really fun show.

name: ariel
text: i think they started off traditional because this is what got them into festivals in the celtic circuit and now they are trying to change things up a bit

name: ariel
text: i hope they do not go to far off this route or they might not keep their celtic rock fan base and then that could be bad

name: shelly
text: Interesting vincent. I didn't detect much jazz in the music in my space. Why don't you push that aspect more?

name: ariel
text: hahaha, funny you should mention jazz, the bass player and drummer of ETH are originally jazz musicians and i think you can sense this sometimes

name: vincent
text: it comes out more live, and more in maybe the older stuff (the white record with the trees on the cover)... it shows up mostly in the weird chords in the guitar stuff.

name: shelly
text: Listening to The Litter and the Leaves right now. Great stuff.

name: vincent
text: and the looseness of the drums, I get to play stuff different every time.

name: ariel
text: hahahahaha, ah yes that is a favorite of the new album

name: ariel
text: people keep mentioning it

name: shelly
text: Always gotta mash up the rhythms. Otherwise, it gets boring, no?

name: vincent
text: right.

name: ariel
text: got to keep things interesting

name: shelly
text: You know a band is tight if the drummer can mess with the rhythm and the other players follow along and the music stays good.

name: ariel
text: especially when you do a lot of touring i would say

name: vincent
text: yeah, that's my favorite thing.

name: vincent
text: to do and to hear.

name: shelly
text: How long are your shows usually vincent?

name: vincent
text: we don't usually play super long, 40 minutes?

name: vincent
text: unless we're the only band of the night, which usually doesn't happn on tour.

name: shelly
text: Do you have a standard play list on a tour, or do you mix it up every night?

name: ariel
text: do you get air time on the radio?

name: vincent
text: we switch it up a lot.  pretty much only college radio and indie stuff.

name: vincent
text: we have a little better luck with radio in Europe.

name: vincent
text: the radio isn't such a music-industry insitution over there... people play what they want.

name: ariel
text: that is cool

name: shelly
text: I was a college DJ. I loved playing weirdass stuff nobody ever heard of. I would play things if I thought the album cover was cool (dating myself here).

name: ariel
text: i wonder if ETH has looked into that

name: vincent
text: yeah, college radio is really special.  you can hear some stuff you wouldn't hear anywhere else.

name: shelly
text: Higher ups always tried to give me a playlist. I ignored them. Wasn't "employee of hte month" much. ;)

name: ariel
text: i always liked listening to cool stuff on college radio

name: vincent
text: as DJ's even, like, whoa, what's this?  let's play it?

name: ariel
text: they are the up and coming fans, get them interested and who knows what will happen

name: shelly
text: We have a station around here that run by AMC (public radio) at 97.7. They are like a college station but even more eclectic. They are on teh web too. Exit 97.7 I think.

name: vincent
text: totally.

name: ariel
text: i would have loved being a DJ except i think i would have been too shy

name: ariel
text: but getting to play all sorts of cool music

name: vincent
text: whoa!  chat freakout!!!!

name: ariel
text: would have been fun

name: vincent
text: my screen went nuts

name: vincent
text: you could have done the "all music, no talking" hour!

name: ariel
text: yeah every once and a while i get the chat in clumps

name: shelly
text: They've discovered us. Gak! Hide the stuff!

name: ariel
text: true, if only i had thought of that now

name: ariel
text: then

name: vincent
text: I don't know shelly and ariel!

name: vincent
text: I just got here!

name: ariel
text: wait what?

name: shelly
text: Also, you are talking to a mic. No one's around and if you play really weird stuff, you can imagine that no one is listening. That frees you up a bit.

name: vincent
text: nothing.  playing along with shelly's "hide the stuff" joke

name: ariel
text: you are i your own little world

name: ariel
text: my sister's friend is a dj at her school and i always bug her to play enter the haggis

name: ariel
text: oh i see

name: ariel
text: haha

name: shelly
text: I always knew my roomies and girl were listening so I couldn't go too far off the rails. Sometimes I would have them up in the studio and they would help me DJ. We used to read PSAs in weird voices. I was a serious troublemaker. ;)

name: vincent
text: is it time to stop now?

name: vincent
text: haha

name: ariel
text: now i am wishing i could have heard you,

name: ariel
text: must have been a blast

name: ariel
text: well sure i could go, i have a million things to accomplish today

name: shelly
text: Looks like it. Thanks for the fun chat. Maybe I'll "see" you all this weekend.

name: vincent
text: too bad you didn't record your shows.

name: vincent
text: yeah, I'm on for tomorrow.  super early (for me) again.

name: shelly
text: Yah, thank god. I wouldn't want that to have been preserved. Yikes!

name: shelly
text: Bye all.

name: vincent
text: bye!

name: ariel
text: haha, ok, bye
